page.title: 20LANDSCAPE OF LEADENHAM
page.content: Looking in any direction from the village of Leadenham,the first thing noticed is that all of Lincolnshire is certainly not flat. People from outside the County always equate Lincolnshire with flat countryside.The outlook from this village shows quite a different picture.To the east the land rises up towards the Lincolnshire Cliff.The fields which form this part of the landscape show a variety of colours as the seasons alter giving an ever changing picture.To the west the land falls away towards the Trent Valley.This gives a varying picture of fields broken only by the A17 road. This survey has been compiled by the Leadenham Branch of the Women's Institute,assisted by Terry Cockerill and Andy Anderson and with much help from the residents of the Village.
